title: David GIlmour - 2015-12-11 - Live at Pompeia - Sao Paulo
description:
Here is a nice bootleg. Check my account for more classic bootlegs.

Please enjoy, share with friends and please seed :)


David Gilmour LIVE AT POMPEIA - Sao Paulo, Brazil - 2015-12-11 MULTICAM DVD NSTC

DVD (two disc set) ready for burning.

David Gilmour
December 11th, 2015.
Allianz Parque
SÃ£o Paulo, SP
Brazil

Lineage
Audio source: CA11 > CA9200 > Zoom H4n > Audacity (tracking, split) > WAV 96 kHz, 24 bit > TLH > FLAC > WAV > Normalize > A little EQ > AC3 224kbps 48 kHz 16 bit

Video: many different sources (mostly raw video from mobile phones and handcams but also recoded files from video sharing websites) all with at least 720P/1080P resolution > Adobe Premiere (Crop or 720P Downscale if needed/Multicam Editing) > MPEG2 7Mbps 480P > DVD Architect (Authoring)


Tracklist

Disc One
01 - Five A.M.
02 - Rattle That Lock
03 - Faces Of Stone
04 - Wish You Were Here
05 - A Boat Lies Waiting
06 - The Blue
07 - Money (1st & 2nd tries)
08 - Money
09 - Us And Them
10 - In Any Tongue
11 - High Hopes

Disc Two
01 - Astronomy Domine
02 - Shine On You Crazy Diamond
03 - Fat Old Sun
04 - On An Island
05 - The Girl In The Yellow Dress
06 - Today
07 - Sorrow
08 - Run Like Hell
09 - Time
10 - Breathe (Reprise)
11 - Comfortably Numb

Approx.: 156 min.

Bonus Features:
01 - On The News (only available in portuguese)

Approx.: 10 min.

Full cover artwork files included.

Pink Floyd fans all over the world, we hope you enjoy this two month effort release. It was made thinking of all you guys :)

A very special MULTICAM release shot mostly from people located in the premium area of the stadium, seated at their chairs, therefore very close to the stage and generally with stable enough or less shaky footage. Some songs had up to 9 different point of views available during video editing.

This is the very first concert of David Gilmour in Brazil. A special night for Brazilian fans of all ages who waited many years for a chance to see him perfoming live.

The title name "Live At Pompeia" was choosed as Allianz Parque (a multiporpouse stadium) is located near by Pompeia Village at Sao Paulo City.

As an interesting fact this concert had two interruptions during the beggining of Money when there was a problem with Guy Pratt's bass sound. Available footage from this moment was keep exactly as it was during that night, without any cut.

Video footage from Pink Floyd old songs are by far more available than solo David Gilmour songs from this concert. Songs like "Faces of Stone", "A Boat Lies Waiting" and "The Blue" doesn't offer a complete Multicam experience or may have less picture quality, but they are precious as unique and rare recordings.

Use only as personal, archiving and educational purposes. DO NOT SELL
